section.title: Override browser default behavior
section.para: To override the default behavior for a browser, specify the override behavior for the browser in the Content-Disposition header and assign this header to an object. For example, this header might specify that the browser use a download program to save this file rather than show the file, which is the default.

example.title: Override browser default behavior request: HTTP
example.para: This example assigns an attachment type to the Content-Disposition header. This attachment type indicates that the file is to be downloaded as goodbye.txt:

screen.computeroutput:
HTTP/1.1 202 Accepted Content-Length: 76 Content-Type: text/html; charset=UTF-8 X-Trans-Id: txa9b5e57d7f354d7ea9f57-0052e17e13 Date: Thu, 23 Jan 2014 20:39:47 GMT

Accepted

The request is accepted for processing.
